intro: Lomaria biserrata, commonly known as the serrated lomaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are serrated and have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster. Lomaria biserrata is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand salt spray and coastal winds.
